verb.description: Hinder, restrain, or prevent (an action or process)
Make (someone) self-conscious and unable to act in a relaxed and natural way.
examples: his mother's strictures would always inhibit him

verb.description: (in ecclesiastical law) forbid (a member of the clergy) to exercise clerical functions.

origin: Late Middle English (in the sense forbid (a person) to do something): from Latin inhibere hinder, from in- in + habere hold.
